intro: Biscutella valentina var. neustriaca, commonly known as the Neustrian biscuit flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. The species is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture.
